text:
hi! either the newsletter migration worked or nobody noticed it's been self hosted for weeks already.

this week a reader asked me about the archive before the migration, because of course tinyletter broke all the links :disappointed:

I have them all in my mail and I also have the source I used to generate them, I can even rerun the scripts and do them again (takes as much work as creating a new issue).

I was thinking the best way to bring them back to life,  I was thinking on doing a kind of "this day in foc 4 years ago" and publish an old issue every week starting from the first one, I think the best would be not to send it to the newsletter subscribers, just upload it to the blog and maybe mention it somewhere in social media?

I'm open to ideas on how to make the process of bringing the archive back to life interesting and incremental for me :smile:
